result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Lee Sanford Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the stipulated amount of $183.08 to Lakesha J. first; then pay DNA surcharges, costs, disbursements and supervision fees. Should defendant get revoked, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance would then be apid while on extended supervsion. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is no-dischargable in bankruptcy.

Seek and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.

No controlled substance other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical well-being, and to take them as long as it is deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.
No contact with Lakesha J. or Tierra M.

Undergo a mental health evaluation; stay compliant with any medication regimen.
Urine screens.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

timeConds.notes: straight time, to be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Lee Sanford Jr

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed. rn
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Scott Lee Sanford in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Scott Lee Sanford in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties advise they are prepared to proceed with a plea. Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. State needs to do victim notification. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Court retained file.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Scott Lee Sanford not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; just received and offer and additional discovery.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Scott Lee Sanford not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch on behalf of Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel is missing discovery and has not received and offer from the State. Defense counsel requests adjourned scheduling date. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cash Bond Set entry of 02-08-2014 CORRECTED to reflect bail set at $10,000 not &1,000 per record. jew
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Scott Lee Sanford in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Scott Lee Sanford in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for DeAnn L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correct address of "3400" on page (2).  Sworn for the state:Scott Iverson-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LAKESHA J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Scott Lee Sanford in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Scott Lee Sanford in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
